detaileddescription.para: Modem firmware version string can be up to 40 characters long.
Modem returns RSRP and RSRQ as index values which require a conversion to dBm and dB respectively. See modem AT command reference guide for more information.
Number of legal elements in the enum.

parameterdescription.para: If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the structure that stores modem information.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the modem parameter structure.
If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the subscription of RSRP values.

parameterdescription.para: If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

memberdef.argsstring: (enum modem_info info, char *buf, const size_t buf_size)
memberdef.name: modem_info_string_get

briefdescription.para: Request the current modem status of any predefined information value as a string.

detaileddescription.para: If the data parameter returned by the modem is originally a short, it is still returned as a string.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to store the null-terminated string.

simplesect.para: Length of received data if the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Request the current modem status of any predefined information value as a short.

detaileddescription.para: If the data parameter returned by the modem is originally a string, this function fails.

parameterdescription.para: The short where to store the information.

simplesect.para: Length of received data if the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Request the name of a modem information data type.

parameterdescription.para: The string where to store the name.

simplesect.para: Length of received data if the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Request the data type of the current modem information type.

simplesect.para: The data type of the requested modem information data. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

detaileddescription.para: The data is stored in the provided info structure.

parameterdescription.para: If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Obtain the UUID of the modem firmware build.

detaileddescription.para: The UUID is represented as a string, for example: 25c95751-efa4-40d4-8b4a-1dcaab81fac9
See the documentation for the AT command XMODEMUUID.

parameterdescription.para: if the provided buf_size was not enough. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

detaileddescription.para: The short software identification is represented as a string, for example: nrf9160_1.1.2
See the documentation for the AT command SHORTSWVER.

parameterdescription.para: if the provided buf_size was not enough. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

detaileddescription.para: The hardware version is represented as a string, for example: nRF9160 SICA B0A
See the documentation for the AT command HWVERSION.

parameterdescription.para: if a parameter was invalid. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Obtain the modem Software Version Number (SVN).

detaileddescription.para: The SVN is represented as a string, for example: 12
See the documentation for the AT command +CGSN.

parameterdescription.para: if the provided buf_size was not enough. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

detaileddescription.para: Get the battery voltage, in mV, with a 4 mV resolution.

parameterdescription.para: if the provided buf_size was not enough. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

detaileddescription.para: Get the internal temperature, in degrees Celsius.

parameterdescription.para: if the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

detaileddescription.para: Get the reference signal received strength (RSRP), in dBm.

parameterdescription.para: if there is no valid RSRP. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.
